body.p: To continue exploring cityEHR you will need a larger sample of test patients – these can be generated using functions available on the Administration page, which is accessed by pressing the Administration button on the main system menu (top right of the page).

li.p: On the Administration page, in the menu in the left hand pane, select the menu option “Database” and then the sub-task for ‘Generate Test Data’.
Press the Browse button to load a file containing a sample patient record.

Press the ‘Browse’ button and navigate to your downloaded User Resources Folder. Select the file called: EHR_Extract-TimothyAbernathy.xml (If you want to see what this file looks like, then you can open it separately using a programmers file editor or plain text editor).
The User Resources Folder is the folder you created when you downloaded User resources in the previous section.
After uploading the EHR_Extract-TimothyAbernathy.xml file you should see the full set of options for generating test data, as shown in the figure below

image.alt: Generate Test Data Parameters, Following File Upload

li.p: By default, the parameters are set to generate 10 test records, split evenly between male, female and other gender categories, aged between 18 and 65.

To test these features this example will generate records for Male and Female patients, so you can change the percentages to 50 in each of these columns, and percentages of 0 to the rest (Non-binary, Intersex, and Unknown). The actual number of records to be generated will change as you change the percentages (and an error message will appear whenever the percentages don’t add up to 10). If you would like, once you have generated the 10 records, you can keep the same settings and try generating 100 records. However, be aware that it can take up to 5 seconds to generate each record, so 100 records can take over 5 minutes to complete.
Note that the button to generate test patients will only be active when the percentages across all categories add up to 100%
In the columns for Male and Female patients, change the Forename selection to Male Forename and Female Forename as appropriate.

image.alt: Generate Test Data with Parameters Set

li.p: Once you are happy with the parameters, press the small button on the right hand side of the page to generate the test records. You will need to wait a while until this process is finished.
Once the test data is generated, your screen will look like the figure below.
Now you can press the Dashboard button in the main System Menu (top of the page) to leave the Admin page and view the Dashboard, which should now show that you have the new records loaded.

image.alt: Updated Dashboard with Generated Test Data
